page.title: 04 Whisky Distilling in Keith
page.content: Distilling Scotch whisky is one of the main industries of Keith.The Strathmill Distillery was founded in 1832 by A.G. Johnston.It is now owned by Justerini and Brooks and employs 20 people. The process of making Scotch Whisky takes over 3 years.First the malt barley arrives at the distillery where stones are sifted out before it is ground to a coarse meal.It is thoroughly mixed with spring water and the malt extract is drawn off into fermenting tubs called Wash Backs.Small amounts of yeast are added to form alcohol.This dilute alcohol is then fed into the copper stills where it is boiled and condensed into a clear spirit.The spirit is filled into wooden casks which are stored in large bonded warehouses.After a minimum period of 3 years it is removed for blending or bottling for sale to customers.
